thread.title: Most hilarious Sean Rodriguez vs. Gatorade cooler Internet memes, remixes
thread.title_full: Most hilarious Sean Rodriguez vs. Gatorade cooler Internet memes, remixes | OregonLive.com

author: Joseph Rose | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Most hilarious Sean Rodriguez vs. Gatorade cooler Internet memes, remixes
text:
Updated at 9:20 p.m.
These are the high holy days of baseball, when the electricity of the postseason in October often creates historic hardball memories and magnificent pop culture moments.
Wednesday's wild Wild Card game between the Chicago Cubs and the Pittburgh Pirates had both: Jake Arrieta's supernatural shutout of the Bucs and the bench-clearing fracas that has spawned a thousand hilarious Internet memes overnight.
Ladies and gentleman, meet the Pirates' best hitter on the field on Wednesday night: Sean Rodriguez.
Your browser does not support iframes.
In case you missed it, Roriguez – who appears to be just an eye patch away from becoming a real pirate – was fired up after getting ejected for throwing a punch in the scrum. So much so that he went Rocky Balboa on a defenseless Gatorade jug in the Pirates' dugout.
AAAARgh!
Of course, judging from Pirates fans' tweets before the game, few were thrilled that Rodriguez was anywhere near a do-or-die postseason game.
Wen you see that Sean Rodriguez is starting at 1B in a postseason game pic.twitter.com/G1Cxbn8rDQ
— Marty (@martymcfly53) October 7, 2015
Here's a look at some of the best memes from the Rodriguez vs. the orange drink container bout. Someone even synced the fight to L.L. Cool J's "Mama Said Knock You out."
Survivor's "Burning Heart" probably would have been too obvious.
As someone who writes about pop culture, Internet memes, guys dressing up swashbucklers and video games, I thought these memes and trolls were just too goo not to share. (Full disclosure: I'm also a Cubbies fanatic who tries to make a pilgrimage to Wrigley Field every summer.)
The Pirates Water Cooler even has its own Twitter account now. Just awesome.
UPDATE: Just when it looked like this story couldn't get any weird (or more awesome), Sean Rodriguez has tweeted out an elaborate, Christian-minded apology to the water cooler.
Pirates IF Sean Rodriguez says he spoke to the cooler from last night & apologized personally. (via @SeanJRodriguez1 ) pic.twitter.com/yUyMmcagis
— SportsCenter (@SportsCenter) October 8, 2015
For the full experience, watch the Vines with the sound on.
